intro: Trisyngyne pullei, commonly known as the white-flowered trisyngyne, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its distinctive floral structure. The plant typically features showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and often have a rough or hairy texture. Trisyngyne pullei is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
